Record for a given number of milliseconds and save as a wav file

stopRecording

public boolean stopRecording()
Stop an ongoing recording before the time is up. This may be useful when the user presses the stop button.

Returns:
true when a recording was stopped, false if no recording was going on.

archiveLatestRecording

public void archiveLatestRecording()
Rename the file (basename).wav by appending a suffix. Example: If spike0003 has three recordings already, then the assumption is that spike0003.wav, spike0003a.wav and spike0003b.wav are the names of the existing files. The new name for the most recent recording (spike0003.wav) will be spike0003c.wav. The newly recorded file will then take the spike0003.wav name.
